properties.name: Antigua
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7This was our last stop on the cruise, and that day I was beat from going to so many different locations. But the rest of my family, tells me I missed out on so much because it was probably the best beach they have ever seen, and I seriously doubt that.

properties.name: Barbados
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7If I remember correctly Barbados was the third stop on our cruise. We went to a place called the Boatyard. It has the most beautiful, softest white sand I have ever seen. Here we spent our whole day, jumping off their trampoline into the ocean. We also swung off their boardwalk, into the ocean.

properties.name: Cancun Palace Resorts
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7I have traveled to Cancun aobut 4 times, maybe 3, but I love the resort that my family and I always stay at. The food is somewhat okay, but when you want to play soccer or volleyball in the sand the workers are all for it! They also love to make fun of you when you mess up, and give you nicknames.

properties.name: Cape San Blas
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7I went here for this past spring break. We rented a house on the beach. While down there we traveled to St. George Island and played putt-putt and ate at Harry A\'s and got menus bigger than me.

properties.name: Disney World
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7My sister and brother and I found Stitch, the day I was leaving to come back to school to take my Geography exam on Valentines Day!

properties.name: Dominica
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7All I can say is Dominica scares me! My father and I got off the ship that day just to say we were on the island and we saw it. Well we went into town by ourselves and all these weird old men kept asking my father to buy some of their local favorites for his wife(and they were reffering to me). I wont ever go back.

properties.name: Jamaica
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7Jamaica. What can I say? Well my family and I were all planning to go down there to watch my parents get married, but we went right after Hurrican Emily, so they didnt. There was two feet left of the beach, and we stayed for a week, which was way too long. Although we did find this little whole in the wall place off the side of a cliff. My dad, my brother(who at the time was 8), and myself all jumped off this fifty foot cliff straight into the ocean. It was scary, but amazing all at the same time. After you jumped you had to swim into this cave, where apparently pirates found a lot of treasure and they used to stay there all the time, and climb back up on this really big ladder. We also climbed Dunn River Falls while we were down there, It was pretty cool, but something I would not advise doing twice.

properties.name: Jos Van Dyke
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7To be honest I went here with my family just to go to the bars there. And drink their drink called the soggy dollar.

properties.name: Puerto Rico
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7We went to Puerto Rico off a cruise actually it was the place where we had to meet the cruise because it left from there. So all I can really say about Puerto Rico was it has a very small airport, and people who work there always want to help you and act like you are something amazing even if you arent.

properties.name: St. John
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7I went snorkeling and layed out on the beach the entire time. Just a relaxing vacation.

properties.name: St. Lucia
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7My family and I were not impressed by St. Lucia\'s beaches at all. So I really do not have much to say about them.

properties.name: St. Thomas
properties.description: Posted by Anastasibarnes7I have been to St. Thomas twice. The first time we went because of my parents wedding, which was actually at Megan\'s Bay( I encourage everyone to go there). I have actually decided to take a year off college and live down there for the year and work as a bartender at the bay. The second time we went was because of the cruise, and we knew exactly where we wanted to go, and spent the whole day there. The thing I love most about this place is you can walk out into the ocean and see your feet and the fish that come up to you or around you, and the sand in the ocean is really soft.
